I encountered a similar problem when trying to use cuda in a singularity container. It turns out that the cuda .run installer did not set up a few symbolic links in the appropriate directories. Easy fix.

$ export NVID_VER=367.44 # or whatever version you have
$ cd /path/to/libcuda.so.$NVID_VER
$ ln -s libcuda.so.$NVID_VER libcuda.so
$ ln -s libcuda.so.$NVID_VER libcuda.so.1

I encountered a similar problem when trying to use cuda in a [singularity](http://singularity.lbl.gov/) container.  It turns out that the cuda .run installer did not set up a few symbolic links in the appropriate directories.  Easy fix. 

```
$ export NVID_VER=367.44 # or whatever version you have
$ cd /path/to/libcuda.so.$NVID_VER
$ ln -s libcuda.so.$NVID_VER libcuda.so
$ ln -s libcuda.so.$NVID_VER libcuda.so.1
```
